opt_in_or_out_B2C: Opt-out (PDPO requires giving notice & opportunity to refuse before using personal data for marketing)

Existing_Relationship_Exemption: No blanket ER exemption in PDPO – even existing customers had to be informed and given opt-out chance before marketing. **However** service-related calls (not marketing new products) are allowed. Existing customers who haven't opted out can be called but must stop if they opt out
Known_Exceptions: Charity solicitations and purely service calls are not "direct marketing" under PDPO. **Unsolicited recorded calls faxes SMS** are covered by UEMO (with DNC lists) but live person-to-person calls are currently unregulated by UEMO. Notes_for_Product: **Product Note:** No universal DNC for live calls yet but **do NOT cold-call HK numbers without prior PDPO compliance**. AI voice calls can be used but **do not conceal identity** – start with a clear introduction as required.

opt_in_or_out_B2C: Opt-out (default allows calls but consumers can **register on DNCR to refuse telemarketing**)

opt_in_or_out_B2B: Opt-out (not formally required but advisable to honor requests even in B2B contexts)
DNC_Registry_URL: No public website; opt-out via SMS "reg" to 3627 (PTA service)

DNC_Check_Required_for_ER: Yes – if a number is on DNCR **it must not be contacted** even if it's your customer

Notes_for_Product: **Product Note:** Enable **Pakistan DNCR compliance**: do not contact numbers that have opted out via 3627 (telecom operators likely filter such numbers – nonetheless maintain your own list of numbers to avoid). Limit call times to business hours/local daytime to avoid complaints. Monitor PTA guidelines – they sometimes issue new spam-control directives (e.g. forbidding masking of identities or requiring telemarketer registration). Automated/AI calls should be used sparingly and always include identification and opt-out (to avoid being flagged as spam).

Notes_for_Product: **Product Note:** Rely on Bangladesh's carrier-level DND: if possible **obtain lists or API from carriers to scrub out DND-activated numbers** (currently each operator may handle internally – so as a precaution include an opt-out mechanism in every call/SMS and honor any opt-out request directly). Aim to get explicit consent from users (e.g. via forms or SMS) before marketing calls especially as data privacy laws evolve. AI calls are not common in BD – if used ensure they clearly identify the business and provide a way to connect to a human or opt out.

Regime_B2C: U.S. telemarketing laws apply in Guam (a U.S. territory). The FTC/FCC rules under the Telephone Consumer Protection Act and Telemarketing Sales Rule govern calls. Quiet_Hours_local: Yes – no calls before 8:00 am or after 9:00 pm local time:{index=97}.
